args:
The one who stopped the fight was Shishimai,
a sprightly dragon who accompanied Ieyasu.
Despite this, Botan and Ieyasu's struggle
quickly turns into a competition to see who can
provide the best hospitality, forcing the party
to go into town and pick up supplies.
Fighting is wrong. Bad humans! Bad!
Did we just get yelled at by a talking doll?
Ooo, sounds like it's time for intros!\n*ahem*
I am Shishimai the dragon, attendant\nto Ieyasu.
I'm known as the keeper of good fortune,\nand it's myyyyy PLEASURE to meetcha!\n...Heh, nailed it.
Like me, our dragon companion hails from\nHinomoto, and has come to spread good\nfortune and cheer to all.
A dragon? SURE DON'T LOOK LIKE ONE!
Gya! I forgot to mutter the quiet part'a that!
Aw, there's no way I'm ever gonna be\nlike Marishiten...
You know it! Marishiten's the dragon that\nforged a soulpact with Master Ieyasu.
She's known as the dragon of battle,\nand she's super-de-DUPER powerful!
It is said the strength of Marishiten is\nenough to best ten thousand fighting men.

Her gallant figure is seen as an omen
of victory in battle, as those under her
protection are guaranteed to remain
free from all harm.
Oh, Marishiten is just the COOLEST.
I wanna become a super rad dragon like\nher someday!
Yeah, yeah, we get that you wanna be like\nthis Marishiten cat—but what's that got to\ndo with ya bein' here?
I came here to stop the fight!
Who's fighting?\nI'm just laying down some TRUTH!
And the truth is that my hospitality is\ngonna be about a ZILLION levels more\namazing than Ieyasu's.
Are you mad? Master Ieyasu's hospitality\nis the greatest anywhere, and everybody\nknows it!
Look, guys, rather than standing here\n＂nuh-uhing＂ each other to death,\nwhy not just have it out?
You mean a duel to the death?!

Not...exactly? Look, this hospitality deal is
clearly important to you guys, so why not
actually BE hospitable and see who comes
out on top?
That's a great idea! Plus, we'd get to enjoy\nthe fruits of that little contest, yeah?
A hospitality face-off sounds like a\nrather fascinating experiment.
I don't know if I'm comfortable being the\nrecipient of this contest.
Aw, it'll be fine! Where we come from,\nNew Year's is all ABOUT hospitality!
It's a day made for kicking back and letting\nfolks do nice things for you.
Er, unless you don't LIKE hospitality?
N-no! That's not it at all!
So can we do it then?
Please put your concerns at ease,\n{player_name}.
If we engage in this competition, we will\nneed you to serve as an impartial judge.
Perhaps you might consider our hospitality\na thank-you for undertaking this task.
Oh? Well in that case, I happily accept!
Botan, I trust you have no objections?
Capital idea. I'm gonna hospitality these\nfools until they don't know what's what!
So these are Hinomotoan ingredients,\nare they?

Yes. It's customary for us to eat soba
noodles on New Year's Eve, and a number
of traditional small dishes called ＂osechi＂
on the day itself.
Before you are the ingredients required\nfor the preparation of these dishes.
May I observe you as you cook?
Of course. Er, by the way, Botan...
How exactly did you intend to prepare\nyour feast without any ingredients?
Hey, prince guy! You got any towns around\nhere where I can buy some groceries?
Of course. We'll show you the way.

I will come along, as well. One can
never have too many ingredients,
after all—to say nothing of my desire
to see one of this land's towns.
Of course, this is only if you find my\ncompany acceptable?
Anyone who wants to shop is more than\nwelcome to tag along!
